p: Additionally, cells are normally targets of reactive species such as reactive oxygen species (ROS), reactive nitrogen species (RNS), and reactive sulfur species (RSS). This imbalance may damage molecules such as proteins, lipids, DNA, and RNA and lead to metabolic disorders and diseases such as cancer, cardiovascular diseases, diabetes, atherosclerosis, stroke, neurological disorders, renal disorders, liver disorders, hypertension, and rheumatoid arthritis, among others associated with oxidative stress [ 2â€“ 5].
